definitions.definition: To form stitches in; especially, to sew in such a manner as to show on the surface a continuous line of stitches.
To sew, or unite or attach by stitches.
definitions.example: to stitch printed sheets in making a book or a pamphlet.

definitions.definition: To weld together through a series of connecting or overlapping spot welds.
(graphics) To combine two or more photographs of the same scene into a single image.
definitions.example: I can use this software to stitch together a panorama.

definitions.definition: (more generally) To include, combine, or unite into a single whole.

definitions.example: The stitching is coming undone on this shirt.
